alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Dripping Springs; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Globe, Miami; Mazatzal Mountains; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; San Carlos; Southeast Gila County; Superior; Tonto Basin (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 8:58PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 945 PM MST... At 857 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Roosevelt Dam to near Globe. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Globe, Superior, Roosevelt, Miami, Roosevelt Dam, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield, Top-Of-The-World, Queen Valley, Canyon Lake, Superstition Mountains, Central Heights-Midland City, Tonto National Monument, Goldfield Ranch, Four Peaks, Apache Lake, Boyce Thompson Arboretum, Top Of The World, Claypool and Saguaro Lake. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 216 and 256. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 193 and 198. AZ Route 70 between mile markers 253 and 259. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near Roosevelt Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
